description: Egyptian fractions: number of partitions of 1 into reciprocals of positive integers <= n.
comments: Number of ways to represent 1 = Sum_{k=1..n} b(k)/k, where the b(k) >= 0. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Aug 01 2006
links: Toshitaka Suzuki, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..390
Index entries for sequences related to Egyptian fractions
formula: a(n) = Sum(A092666(i), i=1..n).For prime p, a(p) = a(p-1) + 1. - _Max Alekseyev_, May 07 2012
author: _David W. Wilson_
